Bases: CriMeBase

compute(time_step: int = 0, vehicle_id: Optional[int] = None)

Detects the collision time given the trajectory of ego_vehicle using a for loop over the state list.

detect_collision(state_list: List[State]) → bool

Returns whether the state list of the ego vehicle is collision-free.

Parameters:

state_list – list of vehicle states

commonroad_crime.measure.time.wttc module

class commonroad_crime.measure.time.wttc.WTTC(config: CriMeConfiguration)

Bases: CriMeBase

The worst-time-to-collision metric extends the usual TTC by considering multiple traces of actors as predicted by an over-approximating dynamic motion model. From: Wachenfeld, Walther, et al. “The worst-time-to-collision metric for situation identification.” 2016 IEEE Intelligent Vehicles Symposium (IV). IEEE, 2016.

compute(vehicle_id: int, time_step: int = 0, verbose: bool = True)

Specific computing function for each measure

measure_name: Enum = 'worst-time-to-collision'
monotone: Enum = 'negative monotonic'
visualize(figsize: tuple = (25, 15))

Visualize the result, which will be measure-dependent.
